body_html:
This looks to me like all of your paths are confused:

In your new training code, you have:
train_dir = "/Users/Zanhuang/Desktop/NNP/model.ckpt"
You're writing checkpoints to here:
checkpoint_path = os.path.join(FLAGS.data_dir, 'model.ckpt')

Where FLAGS.data_dir is unspecified... do you provide this on the command line? If not, what is the default value?

When doing eval, you have:
eval_dir = "/Users/Zanhuang/Desktop/NNP/checkpoint"
but strangely
checkpoint_dir = "/Users/Zanhuang/Desktop/NNP"

And you're actually restoring from:
saver.restore(sess, eval_dir)

There does not appear to be a TensorFlow bug here, so I'm going to close this issue.
If you are still having problems making your code work, StackOverflow is a more appropriate venue for general usage questions.

body:
This looks to me like all of your paths are confused:

In your new training code, you have:
`train_dir = "/Users/Zanhuang/Desktop/NNP/model.ckpt"`
You're writing checkpoints to here:
 `checkpoint_path = os.path.join(FLAGS.data_dir, 'model.ckpt')`

Where `FLAGS.data_dir` is unspecified... do you provide this on the command line?  If not, what is the default value? 

When doing eval, you have:
`eval_dir = "/Users/Zanhuang/Desktop/NNP/checkpoint"`
but strangely
`checkpoint_dir = "/Users/Zanhuang/Desktop/NNP"`

And you're actually restoring from: 
`saver.restore(sess, eval_dir)`

There does not appear to be a TensorFlow bug here, so I'm going to close this issue.  
If you are still having problems making your code work, StackOverflow is a more appropriate venue for general usage questions.
